programmes.show_description: Disraeli Gears: Cream's Eric Clapton, Ginger Baker and Jack Bruce discuss the making of Disraeli Gears, their timeless 1967 album that solidified their status as a 'super group'. (S1, ep 2)
Eric Clapton, Mick Taylor and Slash are among guitar stars paying tribute to Jimi Hendrix's magnificent talent and showmanship, as well as his extraordinary legacy.

programmes.show_name: David Gray: White Ladder - From Then 'Til Now
programmes.show_description: Celebrate the multi-platinum-selling album from David Gray, as he details the stories behind some of the songs and the most memorable shows.
Elvis Presley: Film revealing how the King created his seminal debut album. Sam Phillips, Keith Richards and BB King are among those discussing the album and its far-reaching influence.

programmes.show_name: Jonas Kaufman at Arena Di Verona
programmes.show_description: Experience the unforgettable spectacle as Jonas Kaufmann graces the stage once again, performing opera masterpieces at the iconic Arena di Verona.
The Last Of The Midnight Gardeners: An adulterous magazine editor launches a competition for a story involving the perfect murder. But life soon mirrors art. (S7, ep 6)
The Gift Of Beauty: After killing her husband to be with her young lover, an insecure woman is drawn in by a flyer for an anti-ageing process known as the Gift of Beauty. (S7, ep 7)
Wet Saturday: George Princey has a high standing in the community. So when his daughter kills a man, George endeavours to cover it up to avoid facing a scandal. (S7, ep 8)
Sauce For The Goose: Having arranged the death of her very wealthy husband in order to be with her lover Stephen, Olivia becomes increasingly annoyed by his lack of appreciation. (S7, ep 9)
Bird Of Prey: Jack and Edna's pet parrot dies after laying an unusually large egg. On hatching, it reveals an aggressive black-feathered bird, spelling immediate trouble. (S7, ep 10)
Beyond the Sea of Death: An heiress finds a man who loves her for herself instead of her money. After he dies tragically, she tries to regain contact with him via a mystic. (S2, ep 14)
New. Dover Castle: A host of artists try their luck as Wildcards, hoping to impress judges Kathleen Soriano, Tai Shan Schierenberg and Eva Langret. (S11, ep 6)
The sprightly young assistant of a Hollywood screenwriter helps him over his writer's block by acting out his fantasies of possible plots.

programmes.show_name: Sam Cooke: A Legend In Concert
programmes.show_description: Documentary exploring the career and life story of Sam Cooke through first-person accounts from family, childhood friends and the soul superstar himself.

programmes.show_name: The Phantom Of The Opera At The Royal Albert Hall
programmes.show_description: Ramin Karimloo and Sierra Boggess star in this special 25th anniversary performance of Andrew Lloyd Webber's hit musical at London's Royal Albert Hall.
Ten years after a Paris fire left only a mask, The Phantom's love for Christine endures in Coney Island. She arrives with Raoul and their son to perform, unaware of what awaits.
Michael is determined to reform and stay faithful to his fiancée. However, his attempt at fidelity is jeopardised when numerous attractive women become smitten with him.
A look back at some of the greatest past performances at the Opry to commemorate the 100th birthday of the Grand Ole Opry.
Neo-progressive rock icons Marillion perform at the Royal Albert Hall for the first time in their near 40-year career, joined by In Praise of Folly and guests.
The line-up changed, the style evolved, but the hits kept coming. From Peter Gabriel to Phil Collins, Invisible Touch to I Can't Dance, a documentary that charts the inspiration of Genesis.
... at the Isle of Wight: The English rock band perform songs including Nights In White Satin and Gypsy to a crowd of 600,000 as the sun goes down on the legendary festival of 1970.
Leading music journalists explore the music of Peter Gabriel, a founding member of Genesis who went on to achieve great solo success around the world. (S5, ep 11)
Never Mind The B******s: A look at how Never Mind The B******s rewrote the rock'n'roll rule book and defined the punk sound of 1977. (S1, ep 15)

programmes.show_name: Jacqueline Du Pre: Genius And Tragedy
programmes.show_description: Narrated by Yo-Yo Ma, this film celebrates the enigmatic British cellist, whose career was cruelly curtailed by multiple sclerosis when she was twenty-eight years old.
Mountain Stream: In this masterpiece, Bob paints a cool blue waterway that winds effortlessly from a snow-topped mountain in the distance. (S11, ep 1)
Country Cabin: Bob paints an old weathered dwelling, buried deep in the snow and surrounded by protective evergreens. (S11, ep 2)
The Gift Of Beauty: After killing her husband to be with her young lover, an insecure woman is drawn in by a flyer for an anti-ageing process known as the Gift of Beauty. (S7, ep 7)
Wet Saturday: George Princey has a high standing in the community. So when his daughter kills a man, George endeavours to cover it up to avoid facing a scandal. (S7, ep 8)
Revenge: An unknown attacker assaults Carl Spann's wife Elsa. Thirsty for revenge, Carl drives his incoherent wife around town in attempt to locate the thug. (S1, ep 1)
Shopping for Death: Two retired insurance salesmen confront an aggressive woman trying to save from impending disaster. (S1, ep 2)
A look at the life and career of a celebrated Australian filmmaker, known for The Quiet American, Rabbit-Proof Fence and Dead Calm. (S8, ep 6)
A profile of James Coburn, the tough-guy actor in films that included Our Man Flint and The Magnificent Seven, who won an Academy Award in 1998 for his role in Affliction. (S6, ep 4)
Sauce For The Goose: Having arranged the death of her very wealthy husband in order to be with her lover Stephen, Olivia becomes increasingly annoyed by his lack of appreciation. (S7, ep 9)
Bird Of Prey: Jack and Edna's pet parrot dies after laying an unusually large egg. On hatching, it reveals an aggressive black-feathered bird, spelling immediate trouble. (S7, ep 10)
The Garden of Earthly Delights by Hieronymus Bosch: One of the world's most popular pictures, The Garden of Earthly Delights is also one of the most mysterious. (S3, ep 3)
The Polish Rider by Rembrandt: He rides on a pure white horse, but who is he? Rembrandt's famous equestrian portrait has never been convincingly explained - until now. (S3, ep 4)
New. Dover Castle: A host of artists try their luck as Wildcards, hoping to impress judges Kathleen Soriano, Tai Shan Schierenberg and Eva Langret. (S11, ep 6)
A look at the life and career of American director David Fincher, renowned for his psychological thrillers such as Fight Club, Seven and Panic Room. (S8, ep 7)
A fascinating look at the life and career of Dean Martin, the Rat Pack star famed for his film and stage partnership with the comedian Jerry Lewis. (S6, ep 5)
I Like It Here In Wilmington: When a clothing manufacturer finds himself on the verge of bankruptcy, he ponders the idea of murdering his wife for the insurance money. (S7, ep 11)
Accidental Death: Steve and Jane are con artists who gain access to people's homes claiming to be doing research into polish. But eventually, they meet their match. (S7, ep 12)
Premonition: When a man returns home to find his father has died, he suspects his friends are concealing the true details of that death. (S1, ep 3)
Triggers in Leash: A cook stuck in the middle of a life-threatening dispute between two gunmen tries everything she can to end the dispute. (S1, ep 4)

programmes.show_name: Andre Rieu: La Vie Est Belle
programmes.show_description: Dutch violinist André Rieu brings his orchestra to an atmospheric Berlin amphitheatre, with musical favourites like Ravel's Bolero, Lara's Theme from Doctor Zhivago and Auld Lang Syne.

programmes.show_name: Nicola Benedetti & Friends From The Ulster Hall
programmes.show_description: Join Nicola Benedetti for a unique and personal show as she returns to the stage at the Ulster Hall for her first solo tour in over ten years.

programmes.show_name: Classic FM Live: Hall Of Fame 2023
programmes.show_description: Discover the results of the world's biggest poll of classical music tastes for 2023. Recorded 16th October 2023.
